text: Steven John Baker (born 6 June 1971) is a British Conservative Party politician and former Royal Air Force engineer, consultant and bank worker. He is the Member of Parliament (MP) for Wycombe, being in the 2010 general election. In June 2015 he became co-chairman of Conservatives for Britain. He co-founded The Cobden Centre. He was Chair of the European Research Group (ERG), a pro-Brexit group of Conservative MPs, until his promotion to ministerial office at the Department for Exiting the European Union on 13 June 2017, but resigned from his office on 9 July 2018 following the resignation of David Davis over concerns with the Government strategy on Brexit. In September 2022, Baker was picked as Minister of State for Northern Ireland by Prime Minister Liz Truss. ==References== Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs
title: Steve Baker (politician)
